titleStmt.title: John Dennis et al. to Unknown
CWG7049

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: We the undersigned Jurors who tried Jas Long on a charge of Horse Stealing in the Jefferson Circuit Court & convicted him for four years do pray your Excellency to grant him a pardon

John Dennis
J J Hirschtuhl
J, M, Grove
Thos Reese
H, H, Sale
W. Hardin
A J Woodruff
N, Shouse
John Gill
C. C Rufer
E Cook
John Price foreman
Lee Chambers D C
Jeff Cir Ct

I James P Chambers Clerk of the Jefferson Circuit Court in the State aforesaid certify that the foregoing twelve persons were jurors in the case of Commonwealth against James Long indicted and convicted for felony

James P Chambers
by Lee Chambers D C

I unite in the Petition for a Pardon for James Long for the reason that on the trial he Manifested a Sincere repentance for the act of which he had been Guilty & a modest desire to Keep the matter from the Knowledge of his father & family

Geo. W Johnston
ct Judge
J R Dupuy
com atty
